data.title: Jill Goldsmith, JD, LAC, NCC - Goldsmith College Consulting
data.meta_description: See what is not there. Hear what is not said. In these spaces, gaps and opportunities… · Experience: Goldsmith College Consulting  · Education: Arizona State University · Location: Phoenix · 500+ connections on LinkedIn. View Jill Goldsmith, JD, LAC, NCC’s profile on LinkedIn, a professional community of 1 billion members.
data.text:
International high school exchange program, which promotes peace and understanding through cultural exchange.

Mentor international exchange students during their high school experience in Arizona.

Leadership roles include: support coordinator, volunteer coordinator, orientations committee.

Developed and ran program for Muslim international high school exchange students and local Jewish teens to develop mutual understanding and tolerance.

• International high school exchange program, which promotes peace and understanding through cultural exchange.

• Mentor international exchange students during their high school experience in Arizona.

• Leadership roles include: support coordinator, volunteer coordinator, orientations committee.

Developed and ran program for Muslim international high school exchange students and local Jewish teens to develop mutual understanding and tolerance.

Volunteered in Cape Town South Africa, serving women and children (June 2017).

For those interested in Latina/o educational attainment, I encourage you to read my article, published in The Journal of Educational Research, "Fostering the academic success of their children: Voices of Mexican immigrant parents."

It is a strength-based qualitative study that provides insights from Mexican immigrant parents who have academically successful children. Their insights, including how they use their culture as a source of strength, can help other similarly situated parents help…

For those interested in Latina/o educational attainment, I encourage you to read my article, published in The Journal of Educational Research, "Fostering the academic success of their children: Voices of Mexican immigrant parents."

It is a strength-based qualitative study that provides insights from Mexican immigrant parents who have academically successful children. Their insights, including how they use their culture as a source of strength, can help other similarly situated parents help their children succeed in school.
